reviewText: It's creepy and AI is bad, but there is something about this game and with a determined developer it may be a good wave survival title. I would give a neutral review, but there is no such a option so let it be a slightly positive review because I believe the AI can be fixed. The game is quite new and updates are still coming out. Environment and weapons looks pretty good and music is just terrifying.

reviewText:
FEATURES -You can slow down time
-Able to change the gravity
-Very deep settings to change the game to how you want to play it
-There is a gun range
-A survival crafting system in progress
-JIMBOB sends out patches or updates almost daily!

GAMEPLAY -The waves steadily get harder with 10 more enemys every wave, as well as 4 kind of Boss" monsters that roam the corners of the map.
-There is a food/water system that functions pretty well (can be toggled)
-There is a stamina bar now so you can't run forever (can be toggled)
-Regnerating health (can be toggled)
-God mode for people who hate playing games (can be toggled)
-Whole lot of weapons for you to find
-Pretty big map
date:
with another one being worked on
-Secret location or two
-Easter Eggs
-Loadouts you can choose from or you can start with a knife
-More powerfull variations of weapons

MAPS There are four maps that we know of so far:
-One that can't be played yet but looks like an alien ship based on the picture
-Grimlock Island which is a test for survival crafting and building
-Flooded Grounds which was the first map
-Rendlesham Forest is a new wave map

ENEMYS    There are 8 enemys so far:
-A small brown alien with demon eyes
-A big Alien that looks like a yellow Gorilla without skin
-Humanoid aliens with green eyes
-Zombies
-An alien that shoots a gun
-A deformed giant white lobster
-A another deformed giant lobster
hoursPlayed: pretty hard to kill unless you have a rocket launcher. (Takes 6 shots from a laser shotgun

reviewText:
EDIT: A TON of new content has been added expanding upon the game, for example a new Building/Crafting mode which is like a Survival mode type thing, lots of new maps (Like Rendlesham Forest, Arid Wasteland, etc) a New gun, and loads more I can't put into good detail.
Also, loving the new Snowing feature.
Don't let the bad reviews fool you, this game is darn good.

Now you might be thinking.

But it has bugs and bad AI!No game is ever perfect and AI should be better really soon.
I personally find the AI fine, they might get stuck on something ever once in awhile but it's okay.
Bugs, I have not encountered any yet.

The physics and animations are bad!Physics are very good. It MAY seem like they flop dead when they die, but seriously, is it really that bad?
Animations are really good... Expect for some of the enemy animations. Those are a bit wonky but Jimbob can improve them, it's hard to make animations anyways.

Unity Assets are the worst!Okay, I hate when people say a game is bad because it uses Unity Assets.
I myself am a Unity3D game dev working on my own game and I am using some Unity Assets, what's so bad about someone using a simple Unity Asset? The game has a lot of assets, I know that. But JIMBOB can't make hundreds of models himself so he used models from the Unity Asset store. Why is that so bad? If someone can't model, they are still a game dev and that's what matters.

B-But S-Something else is bad...?What else is wrong? The game has bugs, okay every other game does too.

Now for the review. after explanation why it isn't bad.The game has a ton of weapons right now. Enough to keep you occupied for awhile. There are about 6 or 7 Alien types so far. The game has several maps and the game looks BEAUTIFUL! Nice survival food and water system and good detail on everything. When you look down you can actually see your body and the Flashlight is very realistic, by that I mean when you run with the Flashlight, wherever your gun is facing the light goes onto there.

Rating            Graphics        10/10                Gameplay        8/10                Controls        7/10                Replayability        8/10     Content 8/10   Overall Rating 8/10
I know a lot of you are gonna dislike this review, but you probably are gonna dislike it only because I find it a good game. If you really are that way you should have some affection for the hard working developer.

Show some appreciation for the this Indie Developer.

If you don't like the game... Wait for new updates, okay?

reviewText:
Overall a good game for the price.

Suggestions;

* A city or town map fight would be good.
* An option to randomize weapon spots so a player can't just camp at the same weapon spawn location.
* Have the bad guys try some flank maneuvers instead of bee lining it to the character which often results in their funneling into an easy slaughter.
* Have the bad guy spawn points move about a bit. Example, drop one or a few and then move to another spot.
* A bit longer reloading time for the minigun..right now it loads faster then a pistol.
* The RPG should do more damage I think.
* A 40mm grenade launcher like the M79 would be wicked to have.
* Inventory" hotkey that pauses the game so you can pick a weapon
hoursPlayed: but very weird in a good way
voteText:
variety of bad guys.. and some shoot back which definitely increases the challenge..;-)

For those that don't live just for playing online against often rude players.. this game  is a good and cheap alternative.

Thanks."

reviewText: I will admit that this game suffers from extremely bad AI, but you can tell that whoever made this game cares about it because it looks awesome. The graphics are good, weapons are good and what I found interesting were the in game settings. You can change the time of day, the lighting, brightness of stars, size of the moon, stuff like that which I found cool because you can have the experience you want. There is a survival mode I haven't tried where you have you have to eat and drink the food and water scattered around the map. As I said before the AI is horrible because all the enemies do is run at you, and seem to always know where you are. Another thing I didn't like is that it only has one map, it is a good one but the lack of diverse environments kind of sucks. I give this game a 6.5/10. This game has a lot of potential and keeps getting patched so hopefully more content will be added and the AI improved.

reviewText:
So before purchasing this game, like most games you read the reviews. It was mostly positive with warnings of the game being buggy, not complete. The usuals for a very new alpha game.

However, what people havn't emphised enough is the potential that this game has! A base building, open world, wave survival is just what gamers want.

Throw in a little multiplayer here and there and your looking at a very good foundation to begin a masterpiece!

Its obvious that the developer keeps in touch with his gamers, releasing regular contect ect.

The game is obviously so far away from even discussing a completion date, but I bought this game in the hope that this developer will continue his work and really make somthing of this.

Seriously, good luck.
voteText: 6 of 6 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
When I posted this review I had 0.5 hours. Now that I have 13+ let me say this game FAR exceeded my expectations. Sandbox mode sounded INCREDIBLY mediocre, but let me tell you; everything seen in the survival maps can be customized in sandbox mode. You can create your own maps with an overwhelming amount of prefabs and make your own buildings! I do not think you can totally play them yet, but of course this is still very much alpha. Buy this game.

Old Review below



Honestly let me start off by saying; it would be hard as hell to find a developer as commited as this one. ( UPDATED )

The game is GORGEOUS and the MASS amount of settings makes it all the better.
Gunplay is pretty basic, but still really fun to just spray hordes of aliens.

The game has a few bugs, however. ( All bugs have been fixed in the 3 days since I posted
this review. )

-Unalligned ADS
-graphical quality glitches
-Really buggy LMG

The maps are small, but that's to be expected both of such a new game, and the fact it's wave style.

If you have $4 to blow and feel like a little bit of mindless shooting then I can't recommend this enough.

I'll definately be keeping a close eye on how this game progresses!

reviewText:
Yeah this is a really good game.  Considering all the junk out there, the fact that this game operates so smoothly with it's ragdoll physics and intense creepy monsters...  This game basically just needs steam leaderboards and it's done.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xiXOmspKq1c
My entire previous review was not actually true because there was a critical flaw in the game where the sky and sun were not working.  So I had to redo my video now that we could see, and it completely changes the game.  Sight is an amazing thing!

So now I can see even fewer flaws in this game.  Now I will only complain about the game's performance.  I have built a new computer and I haven't tried a whole lot of games out yet but this one is one of 5 I have tried and it performs very poorly.  New system is a 24 core Xeon E5-2685 (12 core dual socket) with 32GB DDR4, Radeon R9 290.  When I play GTA5 or Witcher 3, I get activity in maybe 5-6 cores and overall it's like 1% CPU usage.  With this game for whatever reason it uses ALL of the cores.  When I'm not recording, it was like 40% split across them all and when I was recording it was 80% (across 24 cores!!!).  Not exactly sure what is going on, it could be just a unity thing, I will try out some more unity games today.  But I figured it was worth mentioning that there is something unusual in how this game is threaded.

Oh, 5:13pm edit: I was also getting like 20 FPS in GTA5 just now somehow randomly and was getting 60FPS yesterday.  Turned out that the new AMD Crimson driver was cooking my video card by locking the fan at like 10%.  So the card was at 100 degrees the whole time and if it caused bad FPS in GTA it probably caused bad FPS in Resilience.  So keep that in mind, I need to make a third video now... *sigh*, but at least in this 2nd video you can at least see what it's all about.  Stay tuned.  But I have not known of an overheating video card to give 80% CPU usage on its own so I still think the game has a threading issue.

That's about it.  So far it looks like a fun game.  I'll add to this more later I just wanted to remove my complaints about the pitch black world, it doesn't make sense once you play the updated version!

reviewText:
Resilience Wave Survival is an endless FPS wave simulator with a single map.  The opening sequences allow a lot of customization on the map itself and offers a dummy training ground.  The recent update of 42 with the promise of a new map in the next update gives promise to a game that should still be in the kickstarter early access phase.  An interesting premise; Aliens invading and you are the sole survivor in this small town(a large map)fighting back endless waves of Aliens and Zombie AI.

I've taken the time to create a video including update 42 and some idea of where the game stands today.  Here is the link hope you enjoy!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k3SJPucocUU

As it stands right now sitting at a price point of 4.00 you are buying into the future.  The future of this game and its progression.  Hopefully, Jimbob games will continue to strive to update this game and expand upon the original content.  It definitely has promise.  If you catch it on sale it should be on the list to pickup.
voteText: 5 of 8 people (63%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
I just want to update my review from negative to positive because I believe that the review I gave originally was unfair. I gave a review after only playing one mode of the game, that being sandbox, now I have spent a little longer playing and now want to say that this game has really great potential. If the developer spends some time fixing things and listening to the players on what they want to see it could be one of the top games of the genre. Im gonna list the good and the bad for game.

Pros: + Nice graphics (I was playing on max)
+ Nice assortment of weapons
+ Large amount of enemys including boss enemies
+ Different game modes to play
+ Great concept
+ Developer is very active and responds to comments and updates the game on a regular basis

Now the bad
Cons: - Ui can be annoying at times
- Not enough time between rounds
- Sandbox mode is hard to figure out (For me it is, others may not have this issue)
- Animations are mediocre
- Weapon models need working on
- Driving the buggy allows you to see under the map
- Bugs as all Early access games experiance
- Price has increased and really should not have yet
- Dont have leaderboards that I know of.

These issues are really nothing groundbreaking and can be fixed with no problem. I really had alot of fun with the small amount of time I spent playing. My hrs on the game are more than listed. I would say I have around about 5-6 hrs. Also its a good game for the price but its went from 3.99 to 5.99. Thats about a third of the original price. I think its too soon for the increase but I dont know his situation so I may be wrong.

reviewText: Ugh, where do I start...  The game I suppose is okay for the price but would I recommend it?  I don't know.  If you are looking for a way to pass time in waiting for a phenomenal game to download, this game is a good way to pass time in the meantime.  I got bored within about 10 minutes of gameplay, however.  The enemies are all clones of each other, the AI is horrendous.  When you climb up a ladder the enemies will run into the object you are climbing up, not knowing to climb up after you, until you inevitably fall down cause the game makes it difficult to climb down or maneauver around the poorly placed safe" zone.  My character randomly switches weapons.  My health depletes when I cannot find the last couple aliens to kill in a wave.  My character also cannot swim
date: he just "floats" very slowly in water while the enemies walk into and under it at full speed like it isn't even there.  The landscape gets pretty boring as well and it seems like that is the only map you will be given in the game
recommended: as I have no interest in progressing in this game any further.  For the price
hoursPlayed: I'll let most of this slide
voteText: but improvements to the game with a higher asking price as compensation would've been greatly appreciated.  Is it fun?  Yes
helpfulPercent: somewhat.  Does it have nice graphics?  Sure
votesHelpful: but it's very repetitive and seems unfinished.  Overall 3/10."

reviewText: Developer indicates the minimum requirement as Shader Model 3.0 graphic card" and 2GB of RAM but it does not even get to main menu in 4.1 graphic card (GT240M) and 4GB RAM. Getting Unity PE and downloading free assets are enough for being "developer" nowadays...\n\nFor the readers: if you have high-end specifications and you like survival games
recommended: by all means. But take note
hoursPlayed: "developer" is only 1 person and there is absolutely no Q&A management in this game."

reviewText: As soon as the game downloaded, I was waiting for amazing graphics (which I got) and great gameplay. I got a game that crashed and froze my computer multiple times. This game has alot of potential, don`t get me wrong there, but as soon as I started playing, my screen blinked and froze, there was delayed reactions (such as prone and shooting). I would recommend this game. Only after it`s been fixed up, alot. This game can be so much better with the bugs and glitches removed.\n\nI wouldn`t recommend this game at the moment. But later on it`s progression line and when it gets better, then I would.

reviewText: This game is being made by 1 person. There is a wave survival mode, and there is an alpha option that anyone can try. The dev is focussing on the alpha, which is like a playground to screw around with new features, which is surprisingly fun. The wave survival mode is kinda boring but can still be fun. It's only 6 bucks so I would easily recommend it.
